title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 70-3.3 - Generally accepted and alternative operating parameters
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 70-3.3 - Generally accepted and alternative operating parameters

State Regulations
(a) Unless other operating parameters have been approved pursuant to subdivision (c) of this section, operating parameters for treating of regulated medical waste in a gravity-feed autoclave shall be: (1)
at least 60 minutes residence time at a temperature at least 121° C and a pressure of 15 pounds per square inch (15 psig); or
(2)
at least 45 minutes residence time at a temperature at least 135° C and a pressure of 31 pounds per square inch (31 psig). (b) Unless other operating parameters have been approved pursuant to subdivision (c) of this section, operating parameters for treating regulated medical waste in a vacuum-displacement autoclave shall be: (1)
at least 45 minutes residence time at a temperature at least 121° C and a pressure of 15 pounds per square inch (15 psig); or
(2)
at least 30 minutes residence time at a temperature at least 135° C and a pressure of 31 pounds per square inch (31 psig). (c) No facility shall treat regulated medical waste using an autoclave at operating parameters other than those prescribed in subdivision (a) or (b) of this section, unless the treatment method has been approved by the department as an alternative treatment technology pursuant to Subpart 70-5 of this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
70-3.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
